defs: an act fit to be performed by wise people.
an act to be performed by Jaina people.
a Jaina religious woman under solemn vows.
a man with exemplary behaviour.
(archaic) a mode of addressing one's husband.
a man who does not regard or wilfully disregards, elders.
the tree Acacia farnesiana of Mimosae family; fragrant acacia.
a man dressed in decent robes, worthy of being worn by wise-men.
a particular act to be performed by Jaina people.
a reformed Hindu religious body or school, founded by Svāmi Dayānanda Sarasvati (1824-83) in 1875 based on the Vēdas, opposing idolatry, caste, child-marriage and other social evils.
(rhet.) a metre corresponding to 'ಕಂದ'.
a woman belonging to the traders' community.
the tract of the land in northern India surrounded by the Himalayas on the north, Vindya mountain in the south.
a respectable woman.
a Jaina religious woman under solemn vows.
the act or process of converting a race into 'ಆರ್ಯ'.
the act or process of making another adopt the way of life, outlook and the philosophy of ಆರ್ಯ.
a respectable woman; (also used as a mode of addressing elderly and respectable woman).
the goddess Pārvati, the consort of Śiva.
a metre, regulated by the number of syllabic instants, having twelve syllabic instants each in the first and third quarters and eighteen in the second, and fifteen in the fourth quarters.
elders' speech, advice or wisdom.
of or relating to ancient (Indian) sages; followed or used by them.
of times long past; belonging to the early history; ancient.
spiritually perfect or pure; untainted by evil or sin; saintly; sacred; holy.
one of the eight forms of marriage in which the bride's father receives one or two pairs of cows from the bridegroom.
that which is belonging to the ancient Indian sages; the quality or fact of being so; ancient manners, customs, etc.
the quality or fact of being related to very ancient times; the state or fact of existing for a very long time.
the quality of being holy or sacred (on account of being ancient).
the vision of the ancient seers; any of the philosophies propounded by them.
= ಆರ್ಷದರ್ಶನ.
an ox of suitable age for using in ploughing and other domestic purpose.
the opinion, judgement of ancient Indian sages (as a guideline).
the saying, speech, opinion, philosophy of the ancient sages.
the knowledge, inherited from the ancient sages, considered as wealth.
the mystical hymns of Vedas.
followed by or relating to the ancient Indian sages.
of olden times; ancient; traditional.
holy; sacred.
designating or of the earliest geological era, covering all the time before the Cambrian Period; pre-Cambrian.
a man belonging to an ancient time.
= ಆರ್ಷೇಯಯುಗ.
(geol.) the era covering all the time before the Cambrian period, designating the highly crystalline, igneous and metamorphic rocks formed during that time; pre-Cambrian era.
the meaning, intention or signification of the scriptures as originally meant by the ancient Indian sages.
the act or practice of deceiving; deception; cheating.
relating to arhanta, any of the twenty four Jaina spiritual teachers.
the status of the highest Jaina spiritual teacher.
one of the fifty three spiritual ceremonies observed during the period of Arhanta's development in his mother's womb.
worthiness for deserving something; legal or moral eligibility.
the position or status of Arhanta, any of the twenty four spiritual teachers.
Jainism, a Hindu religion resembling Buddhism, founded in the 6th cent. B.C., which emphasises asceticism and reverence for all living beings.
(Jain.) the personified goddess of final beatitude.
of or relating to Jainism.
= ಆರ್ಹಂತ್ಯಧರ್ಮ.
to shout aloud; to scream.
ಆಲಕರೆ ālakare to call a person by shouting (his name or making a screaming sound); ಆಲಿಕೊಳ್ ālikoḷ to shout aloud; to scream.
all those claiming descent from a common ancestor; lineage; family.
the tree Ficus bengalensis ( = F. indica) of Moraceae family, with rooting branches; banyan tree.

ಆಲದ ಪಣ್ ālada paṇ the fruit of the banyan tree (Ficus bengalensis); ಆಲದ ಬಿೞಲು ālada biłalu the shoot that grows from the branches of banyan tree (Ficus bengalensis) and which take root and form a new trunk; ಆಲದ ಮರ ālada mara = ಆಲ1.ಅಪ್ಪ ಹಾಕಿದ ಆಲಮರ ಅಂತ ನೇಣು ಹಾಕಿಕೊ appa hākida ālada mara see under ಅಪ್ಪ1.
a thing or place that gives support, help, etc.
a person who helps, supports another.
having more breadth or width; broad; wide.
a liquid discharged by poisonous animals.
a silvery-white, brittle, very poisonous chemical element, compounds of which are used in making insecticides, glass, medicines, semiconductors, etc; arsenic.
the red lotus flower .
the red lotus plant.
the tail of a scorpion that contains poison.
the act or practice of deceiving; deception; a cheating.
decorated; ornamented; adorned; ornate.
representing one concept in terms of another that may be thought of as analogous with it; metaphoric; not literal; figurative.
done, said, etc. for the sake of formality, not really whole-heartedly.
dealing with the art of rhetoric or of artificial eloquence.
a man skilled in rhetorics and poetics.

sluggish - a) lacking energy, alertness or vigour; indisposed to exertion; slothful; b) not active; slow or slow-moving; dull; c) not functioning with normal vigour.
a man who is not eager or willing to work or exert himself; an indolent; a slothful, lazy man.
the quality of a person having aversion to work or exertion; disinclination to work; laziness; sluggishness.

want of health; sickness.
a lazy, indolent man.
weariness caused by mental or bodily labour; fatigue.

ಆಲಸ್ಯಂ ಅಮೃತಂ ವಿಷಂ ālasyam a mřtam viṣam (sent.) idleness is the root of all evils; ಆಲಸ್ಯದವನಿಗೆ ಎರಡು ಕೆಲಸ, ಲೋಭಿಗೆ ಮೂರು ಖರ್ಚು ālasyadavanige eraḍu kelasa, lōbhige mūru kharcu idle folks have the most labour.
to look down - a) to regard as an inferior; b) to regard with contempt; to despise.
